member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.Registry
member.summary: Provides objects that represent the root keys in the Windows registry, and static methods to access key/value pairs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.ClassesRoot
member.summary: Defines the types (or classes) of documents and the properties associated with those types. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.CurrentConfig
member.summary: Contains configuration information pertaining to the hardware that is not specific to the user. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.CurrentUser
member.summary: Contains information about the current user preferences. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_USER

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.GetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves the value associated with the specified name, in the specified registry key. If the name is not found in the specified key, returns a default value that you provide, or null if the specified key does not exist.
member.returns: null if the subkey specified by does not exist; otherwise, the value associated with , or if is not found.
member.param: The full registry path of the key, beginning with a valid registry root, such as "HKEY_CURRENT_USER".
The name of the name/value pair.
The value to return if does not exist.
member.exception: The user does not have the permissions required to read from the registry key.
The that contains the specified value has been marked for deletion.
does not begin with a valid registry root.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.LocalMachine
member.summary: Contains the configuration data for the local machine. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.PerformanceData
member.summary: Contains performance information for software components. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.SetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the specified name/value pair on the specified registry key. If the specified key does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The full registry path of the key, beginning with a valid registry root, such as "HKEY_CURRENT_USER".
The name of the name/value pair.
The value to be stored.
member.exception: is null.
does not begin with a valid registry root. -or- is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The is read-only, and thus cannot be written to; for example, it is a root-level node.
The user does not have the permissions required to create or modify registry keys.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.SetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind)
member.summary: Sets the name/value pair on the specified registry key, using the specified registry data type. If the specified key does not exist, it is created.
member.param: The full registry path of the key, beginning with a valid registry root, such as "HKEY_CURRENT_USER".
The name of the name/value pair.
The value to be stored.
The registry data type to use when storing the data.
member.exception: is null.

does not begin with a valid registry root.-or- is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).-or- The type of did not match the registry data type specified by , therefore the data could not be converted properly.
The is read-only, and thus cannot be written to; for example, it is a root-level node, or the key has not been opened with write access.
The user does not have the permissions required to create or modify registry keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.Registry.Users
member.summary: Contains information about the default user configuration. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_USERS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive
member.summary: Represents the possible values for a top-level node on a foreign machine.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.ClassesRoot
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.CurrentConfig
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.CurrentUser
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_CURRENT_USER base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.LocalMachine
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.PerformanceData
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive.Users
member.summary: Represents the HKEY_USERS base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the method, to open this node remotely.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey
member.summary: Represents a key-level node in the Windows registry. This class is a registry encapsulation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey for write access.
member.returns: The newly created subkey, or null if the operation failed. If a zero-length string is specified for , the current object is returned.
member.param: The name or path of the subkey to create or open. This string is not case-sensitive.
member.exception: is null.
The user does not have the permissions required to create or open the registry key.
The on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).
The cannot be written to; for example, it was not opened as a writable key , or the user does not have the necessary access rights.
The nesting level exceeds 510.-or-A system error occurred, such as deletion of the key, or an attempt to create a key in the root.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey with the specified access. Available starting in .NET Framework 2015
member.returns: The newly created subkey, or null if the operation failed. If a zero-length string is specified for , the current object is returned.
member.param: The name or path of the subkey to create or open. This string is not case-sensitive.
true to indicate the new subkey is writable; otherwise, false.
member.exception: is null.
The user does not have the permissions required to create or open the registry key.
The current cannot be written to; for example, it was not opened as a writable key, or the user does not have the necessary access rights.
The nesting level exceeds 510.-or-A system error occurred, such as deletion of the key, or an attempt to create a key in the root.

member.summary: Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey with the specified access. Available starting in .NET Framework 2015
member.returns: The newly created subkey, or null if the operation failed. If a zero-length string is specified for , the current object is returned.

true to indicate the new subkey is writable; otherwise, false.
The registry option to use.

member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.DeleteSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey, and specifies whether an exception is raised if the subkey is not found.
member.param: The name of the subkey to delete. This string is not case-sensitive.

Indicates whether an exception should be raised if the specified subkey cannot be found. If this argument is true and the specified subkey does not exist, an exception is raised. If this argument is false and the specified subkey does not exist, no action is taken.
member.exception: has child subkeys.
does not specify a valid registry key, and is true.
is null.

The user does not have the necessary registry rights.

member.summary: Writes all the attributes of the specified open registry key into the registry.

member.summary: Gets the view that was used to create the registry key.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryOptions
member.summary: Specifies options to use when creating a registry key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryOptions.None
member.summary: A non-volatile key. This is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryOptions.Volatile
member.summary: A volatile key. The information is stored in memory and is not preserved when the corresponding registry hive is unloaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind
member.summary: Specifies the data types to use when storing values in the registry, or identifies the data type of a value in the registry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.Binary
member.summary: Binary data in any form. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_BINARY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.DWord
member.summary: A 32-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_DWORD.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.ExpandString
member.summary: A null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables, such as %PATH%, that are expanded when the value is retrieved. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_EXPAND_SZ.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.MultiString
member.summary: An array of null-terminated strings, terminated by two null characters. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_MULTI_SZ.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.None
member.summary: No data type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.QWord
member.summary: A 64-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_QWORD.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.String
member.summary: A null-terminated string. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_SZ.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind.Unknown
member.summary: An unsupported registry data type. For example, the Microsoft Win32 API registry data type REG_RESOURCE_LIST is unsupported. Use this value to specify that the method should determine the appropriate registry data type when storing a name/value pair.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions
member.summary: Specifies optional behavior when retrieving name/value pairs from a registry key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions.DoNotExpandEnvironmentNames
member.summary: A value of type is retrieved without expanding its embedded environment variables.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueOptions.None
member.summary: No optional behavior is specified.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView
member.summary: Specifies which registry view to target on a 64-bit operating system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView.Default
member.summary: The default view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView.Registry32
member.summary: The 32-bit view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryView.Registry64
member.summary: The 64-bit view.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeRegistryHandle
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Represents a safe handle to the Windows registry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeRegistryHandle.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that represents the pre-existing handle to use.
true to reliably release the handle during the finalization phase; false to prevent reliable release.

member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights
member.summary: Specifies the access control rights that can be applied to registry objects.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: The right to change the access rules and audit rules associated with a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.CreateLink
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.CreateSubKey
member.summary: The right to create subkeys of a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.Delete
member.summary: The right to delete a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.EnumerateSubKeys
member.summary: The right to list the subkeys of a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ExecuteKey
member.summary: Same as .

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.FullControl
member.summary: The right to exert full control over a registry key, and to modify its access rules and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.Notify
member.summary: The right to request notification of changes on a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.QueryValues
member.summary: The right to query the name/value pairs in a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ReadKey
member.summary: The right to query the name/value pairs in a registry key, to request notification of changes, to enumerate its subkeys, and to read its access rules and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: The right to open and copy the access rules and audit rules for a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.SetValue
member.summary: The right to create, delete, or set name/value pairs in a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: The right to change the owner of a registry key.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.RegistryRights.WriteKey
member.summary: The right to create, delete, and set the name/value pairs in a registry key, to create or delete subkeys, to request notification of changes, to enumerate its subkeys, and to read its access rules and audit rules.
